sect1.title: Backward incompatible changes
sect1.simpara: Although most existing PHP 5 code should work without changes, please take note of some backward incompatible changes:

sect2.title: ASP and script PHP tags removal
sect2.para: ASP tags <% , %> , <%= , and script tag <script language=php> are removed from PHP.

sect2.title: Functions can't have more than one parameter with the same name
sect2.para: It is no longer possible to define two function parameters with the same name. For example, the following method will trigger E_COMPILE_ERROR:

sect2.title: $HTTP_RAW_POST_DATA removal
sect2.para: $HTTP_RAW_POST_DATA is no longer available. Use the php://input stream instead.

sect2.title: Removed functions
sect2.para: Following functions have been removed from PHP:

listitem.simpara: mcrypt_generic_end alias in favor of mcrypt_generic_deinit
deprecated mcrypt_ecb, mcrypt_cbc, mcrypt_cfb and mcrypt_ofb in favor of mcrypt_decrypt with an MCRYPT_MODE_*
deprecated aliases datefmt_set_timezone_id and IntlDateFormatter::setTimeZoneID in favor of datefmt_set_timezone or IntlDateFormatter::setTimeZone
set_socket_blocking in favor of its alias stream_set_blocking

sect2.title: Removed INI directives
sect2.para: Following &php.ini; directives have been removed from PHP:

sect2.title: Drop #-style comments in INI files
sect2.para: Support for #-style comments in INI files has been dropped. ; is the only possible comment indicator now.
